result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:17 AM Defendant Johnathon J King in court.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant states he has an appointment with Attorney Scott Wells tomorrow and would ask for an adjournment. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:29 AM Defendant Johnathon J King in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Defendant states he intends to retain attorney Scott Wales and plans to pay him today.  Court sets an additional status of counsel date next week.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice Regarding United States Passport For Criminal Defendant

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18 (EXCEPTION: can have unsupervised contact with his siblings).  Defendant prohibited from contacting a minor over the internet or using a website to gather information about a minor. Defendant is prohibited from intentionally deleting any history from any computer or device that accesses the Internet. Defendant prohibited from using any application where the content automatically deletes upon the recipient opening the content and Snapchat. Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court. Notice Regarding United States Passport For Criminal Defendant Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours. THE DEFENDANT STATES HE DOES NOT HAVE A PASSPORT.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.
Court Appointed Counsel - Court denies request, Defendant found not to be indigent.
